ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is coming closer to you and closer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Alas the woe for you, alas!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This (attitude) is worthy of you, altogether worthy;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Your ruin has come close, still closer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Woe to you! And then woe to you!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nearer to you (is destruction) and nearer,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Woe to you, [O man!], yes, woe to you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So, woe to you! Woe to you!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Woe to thee, (O men!), yea, woe!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Woe to you [O man (disbeliever)]! And then (again) woe to you!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:34] [Woe be] nearer to you (there is a shift from the third [to the second] person address here; the term [awlā] is a noun of action, with the [following] lām being explicative, in other words, ‘what you are averse to is [now] near to you’) and nearer, that is because you are more deserving of it [woe] than anyone else,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: The Prophet (pbuh) received him, grabbed him and shook him once or twice and then said: (Nearer unto 713 thee and nearer) this is a threat to you, Abu Jahl, it is indeed a threat.
